channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sewage from blocked drain, 30th September
item.description:
Smell of the gulley on the street is digusting. Causing issues with our toilets that is a precursor to a back up. Warned by plumber and have young child in the house - concerned for health.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Blanmerle Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Loud loose manhole cover, 30th September
item.description:
The manhole cover in front of 2 Thwaites cottage, Cray Road has been loose since the road resurfacing making loud noise each time vehicle drives over. This has caused significant disturbance to residence and road users. Can this be repaired before it becomes serious safety hazard please? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Cray Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road view obstruction, 30th September
item.description:
Hiya slightly concerned about the flags on Erith horse roundabout obstructing oncoming traffic view it's a busy roundabout and worried this may cause an accident one is the middle is fine however they have been placed around the perimeter at eyeline level
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crabtree Manorway North, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: This streetlight is off - again, 30th September
item.description:
This light (No. 7) has been out for some time. It leaves quite a large dark area on a street that has a phone theft problem. This doesn't help and needs looking at urgently, please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Charlwood Street, Pimlico, London

item.title: Road collapsing into drain, 30th September

item.title: Three street lights not working, 30th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelmere Road, Petts Wood, London

item.title: Tarmac around edge has worn away, 30th September
item.description:
Tarmac worn away causing trip hazard. I tripped up this on 22nd September whilst out running and have bruised my ribs, cut my hand & arm and grazed both knees.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nursery Avenue, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Approximately 10mm deep pothole on pavement has been a tripping hazard, 30th September
item.description:
Approximately 10mm deep pothole on pavement in front of driveway has been a tripping hazard to my wife who is disabled. It has been more than 2 months and has only been getting bigger because of cats and foxes digging it deeper

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newick Close, Bexley, London

item.title: Issue of Resident from 10 Daintry way E9 5JJ Graham Hawkins possibly tampering, storing items and going in cupboards in Daintry way block for a number of years since 2019 to 2022.The resident Graham Hawkins from number 10 Daintry way who has been going in and out Daintry way block Trowbridge estate cupboards,fiddling with things dressed inappropriately for someone who States they work for Hackney council to a resident who lives in the block. Possibly Hackney council new uniform.Graham Hawkins was wearing grey tracksuit bottoms, half naked bare chest man,flip-flops, tattoo on right upper arm shoulder and his wife's purple washing up gloves to hide his fingerprints with Hackney council keys. Graham Hawkins was An imposter is a person who pretends to be someone else such pretending to work for Hackney council to another resident in the block.reported to the metropolitan police safer neighborhood team Who seem to laugh when they see the pictures of imposter stating he works for the hackney council. police stated Graham Hawkins does not work for Hackney council dress like that and was laughing. Previously housing officer Simon Priscilla has stated the resident Graham Hawkins does not work for Hackney Council but in another breath another co-worker in the similar department ASB who goes by the name of Kathryn McHugh States Graham Hawkins does work for the council and cannot disclose that information. Hackney Council seem to be lying and covering anti-social behavior up protecting perpetrators. The local housing manager Denise corbin has been offloading her workload onto a resident Graham Hawkins unofficially working for hackney council doing Denise corbin job role and inspection job for her.possibly Denise corbin local manager can have the day off unofficially or stay in the office at Hillman Street hackney council for the day and not have to come down to the Trowbridge estate to do her inspections because Denise Corbin just has to pick up the phone and call her unofficial employee that Denise Corbyn uses for hackney council Graham Hawkins who lives nearby to ask him to do the inspection for housing manager Denise Corbin.in return housing manager turns a blind eye to resident Graham Hawkins behavior and anti-social behavior.Possibly Hackney council, corruption here. Which has not been investigated by Hackney council.This resident Graham Hawkins has been arrested by the metropolitan police because he was causing alarm and distressed to a resident,anti-social behavior. Graham Hawkins has a history of violence known to the police But the housing manager Denise Corbin unofficially is employing Graham Hawkins to do her job roll does Hackney council get the picture.if this is the case Denise Corbin is giving this resident Graham Hawkins permission,authorization as Graham Hawkins stated yes I work for the council to do Denise Corbin job role unofficially off the books only between two people knowing and enter the Daintry way block Trowbridge estate to cause alarm and distressed to another resident. The relationship between Graham Hawkins and the local aerial manager Denise corbin friends., 30th September
item.description:
Hackney council pick on vulnerable disabled and learning disability people and do not address antisocial behavior.
